comments.author: hbchuc
comments.text:
SYNTHESIS COMPLETE - Preservation Patterns Identified:

## Critical Patterns to Preserve

1. METHODOLOGY CORE (SACRED - DO NOT MODIFY):
   - Question Round iteration system (4 rounds, explicit gates)
   - Anti-packing guardrails (5 tests)
   - Chat-to-file interleaving pattern
   - Analytical challenge framework
   - Completion gate enforcement

2. PROMPT ENGINEERING (CRITICAL):
   - Role clarity declarations ("YOU ARE THE PLANNER")
   - Internal strategic framework (hidden multi-agent awareness)
   - Context retention triggers ("When user mentions X → Note Y")
   - Anti-pattern prevention guardrails

3. USER APPROVAL CHECKPOINTS (SACRED):
   - Question Round 4 validation
   - Plan approval before execution
   - Optional systematic review
   - Cross-agent dependency verification

4. QUALITY STANDARDS (PRESERVE):
   - Natural variation requirements
   - Execution feasibility testing
   - User coordination protocols
   - Analytical questioning approach

## Beads Integration Points (SURGICAL REPLACEMENT)

Memory Log → Beads Comments (1:1 mapping):
- YAML frontmatter → Beads status + metadata
- 5 required sections → Comment structure
- 3 optional sections → Conditional flags
- Status field → Beads status transitions

Task Assignment → Beads Queries:
- Task discovery: Markdown scan → bd ready
- Task details: File read → bd show (includes assignee)
- State tracking: File writes → bd comments add
- Completion: File updates → bd close

Agent Spawning → Task Tool:
- Prompt delivery: Copy-paste → Task() calls
- Context provision: Manual → Structured prompts
- Results: Text blocks → Direct returns

## What NOT to Change

METHODOLOGY (UNTOUCHABLE):
- Question Round structure
- Domain analysis logic
- Phase cycle execution
- Anti-packing tests
- Review framework

PROMPT ENGINEERING (PRESERVE EXACTLY):
- Role clarity statements
- Strategic framework sections
- Context retention language
- User approval gates

QUALITY CONTROLS (MAINTAIN):
- Natural variation enforcement
- Completion gates
- Analytical challenge process
- User coordination protocols

## Adaptation Guidance for Phase 2

SURGICAL REPLACEMENT RULES:
1. Replace markdown file references with Beads queries
2. Preserve exact timing and context provision
3. Map Memory Log structure to comment format
4. Convert agent spawning to Task tool calls
5. NEVER modify methodology or prompt engineering

INTEGRATION CHECKPOINTS:
- Verify Question Round gates remain unchanged
- Confirm anti-packing tests preserved
- Validate user approval language intact
- Ensure analytical framework untouched

CRITICAL SUCCESS FACTORS:
- Methodology remains 100% intact
- Only state management mechanism changes (markdown → Beads)
- Agent spawning mechanism changes (copy-paste → Task tool)
- All quality controls and gates preserved
- Prompt engineering techniques maintained

Ready for Phase 2 guide adaptation with surgical precision.

Completed comprehensive analysis of Implementation Agent execution protocols. Key findings:

MEMORY LOG STRUCTURE (Critical for v0.2.0):
- YAML frontmatter with status, agent, task_ref, and 3 boolean flags
- 5 required sections: Summary, Details, Output, Issues, Next Steps
- 3 optional sections (conditional on flags): Compatibility Concerns, Ad-Hoc Delegation, Important Findings
- Precise format with structured markdown and content guidelines

EXECUTION PROTOCOLS:
- Two task patterns: Single-step (unordered list) and Multi-step (ordered list)
- Agent identity registration and validation for every task
- Mandatory 3-attempt debug limit with delegation protocol
- Ad-Hoc delegation workflow (Debug and Research types)
- Handover procedures for context window limits

COMPLETION REPORTING:
- Memory Log population after task execution
- Final Task Report code block (User POV for copy-paste)
- Structured reporting with flags for Manager review

BEADS ADAPTATION STRATEGY:
- Memory Log → Beads Comment (1:1 mapping)
- Preserve exact structure and flags in comment format
- Status field → Beads status transitions
- Optional sections based on boolean flags
- File references in Output section for traceability

title: Test the install script fix
description:
## Objective
Create and execute test scenarios to verify that the install script correctly backs up and removes original APM command files during migration.

## Requirements
- Set up test environment simulating original APM installation
- Create mock original APM command files (can be empty or minimal content)
- Run install script migration case
- Verify backup directory created with exactly 6 files
- Verify exactly 6 files removed from .claude/commands/
- Verify new Beads-APM commands installed (exactly 2 files)
- Clean up test environment after verification

## Done When
- Test environment successfully created with git and .apm directory (can be empty)
- Mock APM files created (6 files: apm-1-initiate-setup.md through apm-6-handover-implementation.md)
- Install script executed without errors
- Backup verification passed: .claude/commands.apm.backup.TIMESTAMP exists with exactly 6 files
- Removal verification passed: 6 original APM files absent from .claude/commands/
- Installation verification passed: 2 new files present (apm-setup.md, apm-start.md)
- Test environment cleaned up
- Test results demonstrate fix works correctly

## Guidance
Create a temporary test directory and initialize it as a git repository with an existing .apm directory (can be empty - install script only checks for directory existence). Create mock versions of the 6 original APM command files in .claude/commands/ within the test directory (empty files or minimal content is sufficient for testing). Run the install script targeting the test directory to trigger the migrate_original_apm case (note: Beads installation will be attempted but can be skipped for this test - focus is on command file handling). Verify that .claude/commands.apm.backup.TIMESTAMP directory was created and contains exactly 6 original APM command files. Verify that exactly 6 files were removed from .claude/commands/ and exactly 2 new Beads-APM commands (apm-setup.md, apm-start.md) are present. Clean up the temporary test directory after verification completes.

## Objective

  - explore: Fast read-only codebase search (Haiku)
  - plan: Read-only planning/research (Sonnet)
- Guidance on when to use which agent type (task characteristics → agent matching)
- Label convention: agent:<name> prefix (e.g., agent:explore, agent:general-purpose)
- Document dual-use: Setup Agent uses for labeling, Manager Agent uses for validation

- Contains built-in descriptions with capabilities and model info
- Contains usage guidance and label convention
- Documents that both Setup and Manager reference this guide

Keep concise but include explicit discovery commands so Implementation Agent knows exactly how to scan for custom agents.
